Class Inventory

  • java.lang.Object
    • Inventory
  • public class Inventory
extends java.lang.Object
    Manages an inventory of electronic devices, categorized in a list. Allows adding devices based on user inputs via addDeviceFromUserInput() method.

    Time complexity for adding a device: O(1).

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      Inventory()

    • Constructor Detail

      • Inventory

        public Inventory()

    • Method Detail

      • addDeviceFromUserInput

        public void addDeviceFromUserInput()
        Adds a device to the inventory based on user input. Users are prompted to specify device details such as category, name, price, and quantity. The process allows exiting at any point by entering 'q'. Validates input before adding the device. Time complexity: O(1), assuming adding the device to the inventory is a constant time operation.

      • addDevice

        public void addDevice​(Device device)
        Adds a given device to the inventory. If the device's category already exists, it is added to that category's list. Otherwise, a new list is created for this category.

        Time complexity: O(N) where N is the number of device categories. In the worst case, this method iterates through all categories to find a match or to add a new category.

        Parameters:
        device - the device to be added to the inventory

      • removeDeviceFromUserInput

        public void removeDeviceFromUserInput()
        Prompts user to remove a device by name. Continues until a device is removed or 'q' is entered to quit. Time complexity: O(n*m), where n is the number of categories and m is the average number of devices per category.
        Parameters:
        deviceName - the name of the device to remove.

      • removeDevice

        public boolean removeDevice​(java.lang.String deviceName)
        Removes a device by name across all categories. If the device exists and is removed, returns true; otherwise, returns false. Iterates through each category and device list to find and remove the specified device. Time complexity: O(n*m), where n is the number of device categories and m is the average number of devices per category.
        Parameters:
        deviceName - the name of the device to be removed from the inventory.
        Returns:
        true if the device was found and removed, false if the device could not be found.

      • updateDeviceDetails

        public void updateDeviceDetails()
        Updates price and/or quantity details of a specified device. Users are prompted for the device name, new price, and new quantity. Skips the update for either price or quantity if the input is -1, and exits on 'q'. Time complexity: O(n*m), where n is the number of device categories and m is the average number of devices per category.
        Parameters:
        deviceName - The name of the device to be updated.
        newPrice - The new price to set for the device. If the input is -1, the price update is skipped.
        newQuantity - The new quantity to set for the device. If the input is -1, the quantity update is skipped.

      • updateDeviceDetails

        public boolean updateDeviceDetails​(java.lang.String deviceName,
                                   java.lang.Double newPrice,
                                   java.lang.Integer newQuantity)
        Updates the price and/or quantity for a specified device by name. If new values are provided, updates are applied. Returns true if updates were made, false if the device was not found. Time complexity: O(n*m), with n being categories and m the average devices per category.

      • listDevices

        public void listDevices()
        Lists all devices in the inventory by category, including name, price, and quantity. Displays a message if the inventory is empty. Time complexity: O(n*m), where n is the number of categories and m is the average number of devices per category.

      • findCheapestDevice

        public void findCheapestDevice()
        Finds the cheapest device in the inventory and prints its details. Time complexity: O(n), where n is the total number of devices in the inventory.

      • sortDevicesByPrice

        public void sortDevicesByPrice()
        Sorts all devices in each category by price in ascending order. Time complexity: O(nmlog(m)), where n is the number of categories and m is the size of each category.

      • calculateTotalInventoryValue

        public void calculateTotalInventoryValue()
        Calculates the total value of the inventory, summing up the product of price and quantity for each device. Time complexity: O(n), where n is the total number of devices across all categories.

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Checks if the inventory is empty, meaning no devices are present in any category. Time complexity: O(m), where m is the number of device categories. The method checks each category for devices.
        Returns:
        true if the inventory is empty, false otherwise.

      • restockDevice

        public void restockDevice​(java.lang.String deviceName,
                          int quantity,
                          boolean addStock)
        Restocks or deducts stock for a specified device by name. If the device is found, its stock is updated based on the provided quantity. Time complexity: O(n*m), where n is the number of device categories and m is the average number of devices per category.
        Parameters:
        deviceName - the name of the device to restock or deduct stock.
        quantity - the amount to add or subtract from the device's stock.
        addStock - true to add stock, false to deduct stock.

      • exportInventoryToFile

        public void exportInventoryToFile​(java.lang.String filename)
        Exports the inventory to a specified file. Each device's details, including category, name, price, and quantity, are written to the file. Upon successful export, a confirmation message is displayed.
        Parameters:
        filename - the name of the file to export the inventory to

      • restockaDevice

        public void restockaDevice()
        Exports the current inventory to a file, writing details of each device across all categories. Each device's category, name, price, and quantity are recorded.
        Parameters:
        filename - the name of the file to which the inventory will be exported. Includes path if necessary.

      • getQuantityOfDevice

        public int getQuantityOfDevice​(java.lang.String deviceName)
        Retrieves the quantity of a specified device by name from the inventory. Time complexity: O(n), where n is the total number of devices across all categories, assuming a uniform distribution of devices across categories.
        Parameters:
        deviceName - the name of the device whose quantity is to be retrieved.
        Returns:
        the quantity of the specified device if found, or -1 if the device is not found.

      • printInventoryReport

        public void printInventoryReport()
        Prints an inventory report to the console, listing each device with its details. Includes a summary with the total number of devices and the total inventory value. Time complexity: O(n), where n is the total number of devices across all categories.

      • printInventoryReport

        public void printInventoryReport​(java.lang.String filename)
        Generates and optionally exports an inventory report to a specified file. If a filename is provided, the report is written to the file; otherwise, it's printed to the console.
        Parameters:
        filename - the name of the file to export the report to, or null/empty to print to console.

      • deviceExists

        public boolean deviceExists​(java.lang.String deviceName)
        Checks if a device exists in the inventory by its name.
        Parameters:
        deviceName - the name of the device to check.
        Returns:
        true if the device exists, false otherwise.
